intro: Nunnezharia, commonly known as the sacred violet of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple petals and velvety leaves. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its cultural significance, it is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
